stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Analysis of Malware Focusing on Point of Sale Systems
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description:
This is an analysis of malware that focuses on Point of Sale Systems. The malware attempts to connect to an unspecified command and control server using port 443.
This product is derived from US-CERT MIFR-338371.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
Antivirus Results: Kaspersky: HEUR:Trojan.Win32.Invader Symantec: Suspicious.Cloud.5
Section Hashes 7867660e10a813b2fdbe8acc14fe9be2 (header) 1024 0c9ef34cf91cee6ac2b29f39afd60a49 .text 10240 fb3c90b2f9d21d877fc41cf45d1aa1c4 .rdata 2048 d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e .bss 0 b2f5a899722343e0b1fbc5626b84b69f .edata 512 bf619eac0cdf3f68d496ea9344137e8b .idata 512 0df5436c3314c8ffeb288d903b5c6821 .reloc 1024 f276fda6eb53f6bcca499109a9477617 rscs 68608
Packer type: Custom
This artifact is a loader for an embedded executable. The embedded payload is RC4 encrypted with the key "012345678901234567890" and is stored under the ".rscs" segment. If no parameters are provided, the artifact will default to "-fc svchost.exe -s [.]net -p 443". Any domain name can be inserted for the .net domain.
These parameters are passed to the embedded executable. The embedded executable will start the program specified by the "-fc" parameter in a suspended state. It will then use process hollowing to inject itself into the suspended program and resume it. The program will attempt to contact the specified server (-s) on the specified port (-p).
If the connection is successful, an encrypted message will be sent. The program will then wait for an encrypted response from the server that is 0x1C (28) bytes in length. If a response is not received in two minutes, the program will gracefully exit. SSL traffic was not observed in the traffic generated by this artifact.
Once connected, this artifact has additional backdoor capabilities such as: download file, create process, and terminate process.

Section Hashes 1515dd76f5ebf15e4b4bf73d82de898f (header) 1024 65735b5de7f47be15b0b90a7213dd713 .text 32256 2d45ff57e9880d4bf63278bf3c7d7aeb .data 512 cbb4bb7a325a5d54ede7e42e195afb1f .rdata 3072 d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e .bss 0 cce301a3146e15a331409b4b4c54cb2d .edata 512 bf619eac0cdf3f68d496ea9344137e8b .idata 512 0419c4077ed1af2379bc1b621f3fe6b5 .reloc 2048
This artifact is similar to the embedded portion of the file with MD5: f23a1a936b7970b7f4a5a577deda3b31. However, there are no default parameters specified and no networking activity was observed.
This artifact has backdoor capabilities such as: file download, create process, and terminate process.

Antivirus Results: McAfee: Artemis!0078F5A302BF
Section 8a9753c4a472720b626d52e90b662c53 (header) 1024 36d490d978d7055b6a3de302bb100f08 .text 8704 521b204363c4af4a2de2df955a399a67 .rdata 1536 d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e .bss 0 55d0b29bdda7327c5f8984b047a45215 .edata 512 bf619eac0cdf3f68d496ea9344137e8b .idata 512 b2d89aaa1fdd07e3bb5a93b5c07df023 .reloc 1024
Packer type: Custom
This artifact is a memory dumper. It accepts two parameters: process name or process id and output file name.

Antivirus Results: McAfee: Artemis!EF700C777B7A Symantec: WS.Reputation.1
Section 44a185c8dcf817c41d7cfe82e31a4f5e (header) 1024 09420b0612605e1fc1560bec73f3c268 .text 10240 d1aca3e6872e933233ef004c4fd1e982 .rdata 2048 d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e .bss 0 4d1ea0a34d17469494ca0e4fd6f25236 .edata 512 bf619eac0cdf3f68d496ea9344137e8b .idata 512 0df5436c3314c8ffeb288d903b5c6821 .reloc 1024 5b48ed05d221fd5afa2f1f845d160d22 rscs 17920
This artifact is a loader for an embedded executable. The embedded payload is RC4 encrypted with the key "012345678901234567890" and is stored under the ".rscs" segment. The loader can have two arguments "-fc" and "-fp". These command line arguments specify the process's name for the embedded executable and its parameters.
The embedded executable has the following command line parameters, "-c", "-u", "-l", "-s", "-d", "-p" and "-m".
option c: specified a filename option u: unknown option l: specified a filename option s: specified a filename option d: specified a decimal number option p: specified a decimal number option m: unknown
The overall purpose of the embedded payload is to search memory of a specified process and save the data to an RC4 encrypted file using the key "p0123456789s".

Antivirus: Symantec: WS.Reputation.1
Section Hashes: 850af10cbb792ae8b70f6a4a7393f955 (header) 1536 34368abc0d1499779e4fa0b62d8e56bf .text 264704 5191e5442758c9d55db4969ae1308e16 .data 16384 bf619eac0cdf3f68d496ea9344137e8b .tls 512 b8980d2dcc7c08adacc3276d86c6cc00 .rdata 512 e09278246ea874f85c945e8f272f86a4 .idata 3584 1ebe1dae615a3ad2b7b1ab345ed63d2c .edata 512 1ba08628e67f80cc5ad6c60ca79b994a .rsrc 26112
This artifact is a copy of the command line tool "rar.exe". It is a part of the WinRAR suite and can be utilized to encrypt, decrypt, compress, or decompress data.
